summary: Tens of thousands of shipments containing radiological material—which terrorists could use to make a dirty bomb—enter the U.S. each year through airports across the country. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission and some states issue licenses for import and possession of the material, and U.S. Customs and Border Protection is responsible for verifying shipments entering the country are authorized or licensed. However, we found that CBP failed...
title: Nuclear Security: CBP Needs to Take Action to Ensure Imported Radiological Material Is Properly Licensed
